subclusters.subcluster_name: Excluded - Assigned to Molecular Damage Cluster

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nuclear DNA Strand Break Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on accumulation of DNA strand breaks (SSBs and DSBs) in neurons and defective repair pathways causing neural aging and neurodegeneration.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genomic Instability and DNA Helicase Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes genomic instability caused by defective DNA helicases (e.g., WRN) leading to progeroid syndromes and telomere dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: PARP-1 Mediated DNA Damage Accumulation and Repair Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights the role of PARP-1 in DNA strand break repair and its correlation with longevity through base-excision repair.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: General DNA Damage Accumulation and Repair Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes aging driven by accumulation of DNA damage and age-related decline in DNA repair capacity causing genomic instability.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Excluded - Assigned to Molecular Damage Cluster
PARP-1 and PARG Regulation of DNA Repair and Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on PARG regulation of poly(ADP-ribose) metabolism affecting chromatin and age-related gene expression, linked to PARP-1 activity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage Tolerance Pathway and Genome Instability Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Centers on DNA damage tolerance (DDT) pathway regulation affecting genome stability and mutation accumulation influencing aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Double-Strand Break Accumulation and Repair Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses specifically on accumulation of DNA double-strand breaks (DSBs), decline in DSB repair pathways, and their causal role in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Age-Dependent Shift in DNA Double-Strand Break Repair Pathways Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes how aging alters the relative usage of DSB repair pathways (NHEJ, HR, SSA), impacting genome stability and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: p53 Family Mediated DNA Damage Response and Genome Instability Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes the role of p53 family in orchestrating DNA damage response, repair, senescence, and apoptosis driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative DNA Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on accumulation of oxidative DNA lesions (e.g., 8-OH-dG) and DNA-protein crosslinks as drivers of aging, especially in postmitotic organs.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genome Stability Linking Longevity and Cognitive Function Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes genome stability mechanisms underlie both longevity and intelligence, linking DNA repair and genome maintenance to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: PARP-1 Dysregulation and Chronic Inflammation in Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Connects impaired DNA repair via PARP-1 dysregulation with chronic low-grade inflammation driving aging and age-related pathologies.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nucleotide Excision Repair Deficiency and DNA Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on defective NER causing accumulation of bulky DNA lesions, transcription defects, and premature aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage Accumulation and Longevity-Regulating Pathways Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes DNA damage accumulation driving aging and interaction with longevity pathways like insulin/IGF-1 signaling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Age-Related Decline in Nucleotide Excision Repair Capacity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Shows that NER capacity declines with age, contributing to aging via impaired repair of bulky DNA lesions.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genome Maintenance and DNA Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Posits aging results from DNA damage accumulation and imperfect genome maintenance systems leading to mutations and cellular dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genomic Instability and DNA Damage in Premature Aging Syndromes Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links DNA damage accumulation and genomic instability to aging, supported by progeroid syndromes with defective genome maintenance.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Repair-Transcription Deficiency Interaction in Premature Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on combined defects in NER and transcription (via XPD mutations) causing premature aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Excluded - Assigned to Molecular Damage Cluster
DNA Damage Response Deficiency and Stem Cell Attrition Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes DDR gene ATR loss causing stem cell depletion and systemic premature aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Werner Syndrome and RecQ Helicase Deficiency Genomic Instability Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on WRN helicase defects causing genomic instability, telomere dysfunction, and accelerated aging in Werner syndrome.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation Accumulation and Heteroplasmy Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes accumulation of mtDNA mutations (heteroplasmy) impairing mitochondrial function and driving aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Repair Gene Repression in Cellular Senescence and Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights broad repression of DNA repair genes in senescent cells leading to DNA damage accumulation and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Damage and ROS Feedback Loop Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mtDNA deletions caused by ROS, clonal expansion of mutations, and vicious cycle of mitochondrial dysfunction in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: rDNA Instability and Extrachromosomal rDNA Circles Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes instability at rDNA locus and accumulation of extrachromosomal rDNA circles drive replicative aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Excluded - Assigned to Molecular Damage Cluster
Molecular Damage Accumulation via isoDGR-Modified Proteins Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on accumulation of isoDGR-modified ECM proteins causing chronic inflammation and molecular damage driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Excluded - Immunosenescence Theory (Not DNA Damage Focused)
Excluded - Dauer-Related Genetic Regulation Theory (Not DNA Damage Focused)
ATM/ATMIN Mediated DNA Damage Response and Neural Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes ATM kinase and cofactor ATMIN in oxidative stress response, DNA repair, and prevention of neural aging.
